supercars.name: Bugatti Chiron
supercars.description: The Bugatti Chiron is a high-performance hypercar produced by Bugatti Automobiles. It boasts a quad-turbocharged W16 engine that produces 1,500 horsepower, and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 2.4 seconds. The Chiron has a top speed of 261 mph and is known for its stunning design and luxurious features.

supercars.name: Lamborghini Aventador
supercars.description: The Lamborghini Aventador is a mid-engine sports car produced by Italian automaker Lamborghini. It features a naturally aspirated V12 engine that produces 740 horsepower, and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 2.9 seconds. The Aventador has a top speed of 217 mph and is known for its aggressive styling and exceptional handling.

supercars.name: Ferrari 488 GTB
supercars.description: The Ferrari 488 GTB is a mid-engine sports car produced by Italian automaker Ferrari. It features a twin-turbocharged V8 engine that produces 661 horsepower, and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 3 seconds. The 488 GTB has a top speed of 205 mph and is known for its sleek design and precise handling.

supercars.name: Porsche 911 GT2 RS
supercars.description: The Porsche 911 GT2 RS is a high-performance sports car produced by German automaker Porsche. It features a twin-turbocharged flat-six engine that produces 700 horsepower, and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 2.7 seconds. The 911 GT2 RS has a top speed of 211 mph and is known for its exceptional track performance and handling.

supercars.name: McLaren 720S
supercars.description: The McLaren 720S is a mid-engine sports car produced by British automaker McLaren. It features a twin-turbocharged V8 engine that produces 710 horsepower, and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in just 2.8 seconds. The 720S has a top speed of 212 mph and is known for its futuristic design and exceptional performance on both the road and the track.
